page.title: 16Tourism
page.content: Our area is part of the Scottish Tourist Board which has nine infromation centres in the Region, the nearest being Melrose.Our area is not a well-known part of Scotland.Many tourists pass through on the way to Edinburgh. Tourists can stay in a number of guest houses in the villages or in the hotels, the two largest being the Dryburgh Abbey and the Buccleuch Arms. The former is a three star hotel set in its own grounds while the latter beside the A68 is an old coaching inn. There is a lot to see in the area, much of which is within walking distance.Around each village are many pleasant walks.One popular walk is fro Newtown to St.Boswells along the Tweed.This route leads to Dryburgh Abbey,an 11th.Century Church where Sir Walter Scott and Earl Haig are buried.
